disagree.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to have or express a different opinion from someone else
disagree.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Barr strongly disagreed with Kronfeld’s statement.
He is tolerant of those who disagree with him.
Experts disagree on how much the program will cost.
disagree.translation[0].definitions[1].d: if statements, numbers, or reports about the same event or situation disagree, they are different from each other
disagree.translation[0].definitions[1].e: The statements of several witnesses disagree.
disagree.translation[0].note_box[0].item: You disagree with an idea, or something that someone says
I disagree with his views on the economy
I disagree his views on the economy
Experts disagree about the answer to this question
Parents often disagree on the best way to bring up children
Scientists disagree over whether oil is unhealthy
You say I disagree when you do not agree with what someone says
‘Women are better drivers than men’ ‘I disagree’
disagree.translation[0].note_box[1].sect: disagree/not agree
to have a different opinion from someone else about something
Scholars disagree about the meaning of the poem.
I don’t agree with a word of what she says.
be divided/split
if a group of people is divided or split on something, some of them have one opinion and others have a completely different opinion
The party is divided on this issue.
differ
if two or more people differ about something, they have different opinions from each other about it
The two men differed on how to handle the crisis.
not see eye to eye
used to say that two people have different opinions and ideas so that it is difficult for them to be friends or work together
Some of the teachers don’t see eye to eye with the principal of the school.
be mistaken
used to say that you disagree with someone’s opinion and that you think they are wrong
People are mistaken if they think that this problem will go away on its own.
take issue with somebody/something
to express strong disagreement with an idea or with what someone has said or done
A number of people took issue with the mayor’s decision.
dissent
to say publicly that you disagree with an official opinion or one that most people accept
Two members of the jury dissented from the majority verdict.
disagree.translation[1].definitions[0].d: to have or express a different opinion from someone
disagree.translation[1].definitions[0].e: They disagree on how much the project will cost
Some of the team disagreed with him, but they were too afraid to say so.
disagree.translation[1].definitions[1].d: if statements, numbers, or reports about the same event or situation disagree, they are different from each other
disagree.translation[1].definitions[1].e: The figures in column A and B disagree.
